title: >>> Allied ENEMIES
body_text:
"Let me start off by saying things need to change with dodgeball and they need to change now. My tolerance level is extremely high with certain situations and happenings, but it's time to say what I feel because I am beginning to actually get angry at events. These 'rules', as they should, I too will follow.
First and foremost, stop [negatively] criticizing other people and their abilities on the court. I am tired of hearing comments about how someone used to be good, or how another player can't do this or that. We are friends, let's act like it. If you don't like someone on the court, oh well. Everyone knows the deal; anyone can play, so get used to it.
With these verbal 'invasions', it is simple; ACT YOUR AGE. There is no need to start cursing and mouthing off to a bunch of harmless teenagers. From personal experience, we will not be playing anymore if that keeps up because of 'noise pollution'. Neighbors will complain, TRUST ME. I appreciate what Lauren Freda did last week at XXX-ONE, as well as Chip at XXIV in calling the police. For some it seems like a cowards way out. If that's the case, then take your anger and shouting off the court. I have no time for that, and I know others feel the way.
I was legitemately pissed off last night and I felt I had every right to be. The respect among others has diminished. I have spoken to numerous people already and they too have noticed a lot of the same activity. I LOVE this game and I LOVE the people involved. Let's not go down actually 'fighting' each other.
I highly doubt we'll be playing at age 30. I look at this as a once-in-lifetime chance. We have without question taken advantage of it. Let's continue on a positive note. If anyone has anything to add, please comment. Express your views and your feelings, but DO NOT leave an anonymous comment."
JOHN TRONOLONE
4:36 PM
March 26th, 2006
"This is as relaxing as it gets. I love posting the results. Hope you enjoy them!"
________________________________________
___________________________________
With March exiting, Spring enters into the scene. However, it wasn't exactly the "scene" many were expecting. The very first Spring dodgeball could simply be known as "Wet War VII". That's right, it rained. Although not a heavy rain, but a constant drizzle from beginning to end. But the past has shown that not even the wettest of events have stopped any compatants from entering the fight. This was DODGEBALL 32 ...
"Try and Break Me!"
> Attendance: 29
> Biggest Return: Matt LaMarca (Last played at DODGEBALL 15)
> New Players: (7) Jarid, Steve G, Mitch, Nick L, Melanie, Brian, and Matt J.
> Tom Adams and Ryan McCrorey were captains for only the second time in the careers. Tom defeated Kurt Gassner at the massive DODGEBALL 15. The following event (X6), Ryan went toe-to-toe with Sara DeCuir in the only "Inter-gender" captains feud to date. He too won that night.
> "Prison Ball" made its return at DODGEBALL 32.
> Obviously known, DODGEBALL 32 was the first Spring season event, as well as the seventh "Wet War".
> For the second week in a row, an "invasion" was at hand. However, the suspects remain unknown.
> The poster was created by John Tronolone, despite what "RUMORS Welcome" assumed.
________________________________________
___________________________________
"You Play too Hard!"
One has to give credit to a returning Chris Daly. His last event was DODGEBALL 20, but showed no signs of rustiness. He played barefoot once again and somehow seemed to play a great game.
Kevin Megill is as dangerous as they come. Just when it seems like he's playing possom, complaining about his arm, he throws anyway as the pain goes away for that one second. He is unquestionably one of the best throwers in dodgeball today.
John Tronolone has been quoted in saying he plays better in the rain. That statement could be true when looking at DODGEBALL 32. In one game alone, he eliminated nine out of eleven opponents. He even managed to make it a one-on-one contest with Kevin Megill. But Mr. "Deflection Defense" stopped the wrath of "The Creation", catching a "pain" ball to end the game. The captains from DODGEBALL 30 haven't seen the last of each other.
A true veteran to the sport, Mike "Sputz" has shown time and again that he is a top dog. Rob Avakian and Kevin Adams proved that they too can stop a moving missile. Derek Carty, although only played for a short while, kicked ass and took names proving you should never throw a "pain" ball at him.
________________________________________
___________________________________
"I will Destroy You!"
Both Ryan McCrorey and Tom Adams were looking to keep their undefeated streaks alive, proving to the world they can assemble the best of allies.
In a match that clearly went to the team that was on the "West Side" of the courts, Tom somehow snuck in the extra victory, defeating Ryan six to five.
Literally, every match went back and forth. For the first eight games, all wins were won on the "West Side". The "East Side" played a part in the final victories of the night. Tom's team, despite seeing members leave and enemies defect, pulled off the final win of DODGEBALL 32.
________________________________________
___________________________________
The story continues ladies and gents ... DODGEBALL 33 is the next stop on, oddly enough, April Fools Day.
**The following events come as an unorthodox "Double Header": DODGEBALL 34 on Friday, April 7th and DODGEBALL 35 on Sunday, April 9th.
DODGEBALL 34 ... Wall High School ... 7PM.
DODGEBALL 35 ... Ocean Road Park ... 3PM.
